page.title: 06LANDSCAPE AROUND CWMGORS
page.content: CWMGORS LIES WITHIN A SAUCER SHAPED VALLEY, TO THE WEST LIES THE MOUNTAIN OF BETTWS, TO THE EAST THE MOUNTAIN OF PENLLE'RFEDWEN.TO THE NORTH LIES THE VAST AREA CALLED THE BLACK MOUNTAINS AND TO THE SOUTH LIES THE COASTLINE OF GOWER. TRAVELLING IN A NORTHERN DIRECTION ONE WOULD ARRIVE AT AMMANFORD. TO THE SOUTH LIES THE CITY OF SWANSEA, A MATTER OF 12 MILES AWAY THE ONLY RIVER WITHIN OUR AREA IS THE GORS WHICH IS A VERY SMALL STREAM AND TRAVELS IN A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION. THE LAND IN OUR AREA IS USED MAINLY FOR PASTURE WITH A NUMBER OF OUTLYING FARMS. GEOLOGICALLY THE AREA LIES ON A BED OF ANTHRACITE COAL.
